```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(janitor)
library(cowplot)
library(patchwork)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggpubr)
```

```{r}
water_districts <- read_csv(here("data", "water_districts.csv")) %>% 
  clean_names
```

```{r}
p1 <- ggplot(data = water_districts, aes(x = reduction, y = mc_kern)) +
  geom_point(size = .6) +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_smooth() + 
  stat_regline_equation(label.x=80, label.y=70)

p2 <- ggplot(data = water_districts, aes(x = reduction, y = mc_mojave)) +
  geom_point(size = .6) +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_smooth() + 
  stat_regline_equation(label.x=80, label.y=70)

p3 <- ggplot(data = water_districts, aes(x = reduction, y = mc_antelope)) +
  geom_point(size = 0.6) +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_smooth() + 
  stat_regline_equation(label.x=80, label.y=70)

p4 <- ggplot(data = water_districts, aes(x = reduction, y = mc_ventura)) +
  geom_point(size=.6) +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_smooth() +
  stat_regline_equation(label.x=80, label.y=70)

ggp_combined <- p1 + p2 + p3 + p4

ggp_combined 

  
```

```{r}
# linear models for each district

lm_kern <- lm(mc_kern~reduction, data = water_districts)
lm_mojave <- lm(mc_mojave~reduction, data = water_districts)
lm_antelope <- lm(mc_antelope~reduction, data = water_districts)
lm_ventura <- lm(mc_ventura~reduction, data = water_districts)

```
